text: Oh Paul it's when most of us start
thinking about getting our homes ready
for winter it's also a good time to
think about sealing up gaps and maybe
adding some insulation there are lots of
materials to choose from from bats and
rolls of fiberglass and roll to sprayed
foams and others all of them have
various advantages and drawbacks and any
insulation is good it saves a lot of
energy if it's installed properly we had
our attic filled with a thick layer of
what is called blown cellulose last
spring so I wanted to learn a bit more
about this particular material ours came
from a small family-run operation in
belchertown Massachusetts called the
National fiber company I met there with
Chris Houk who was enthusiastic about
his product you can you can feel a
cellulose insulated house is a new house
the minute you step in the door and what
is it made of we have phone books tax
form recycled cardboard boxes and
newspapers that's right odds are that
there are shredded flakes of the New
York Times newspaper now keeping our new
old house insulated who says there's no
use for newspapers anymore of course one
of the big concerns surrounding
cellulose insulation is flammability it
is paper after all but Hoch and his team
mix the paper with boric acid a white
powder that makes the cellulose
flame-retardant they run a fern test
every day the treated insulation won't
let the flame spread in fact the folks
at national fiber are so sure of their
product that they melted a penny with a
blowtorch on a bed of fiber insulation
so I don't in my hand this is this is
bent here I mean that doesn't matter
that senses a call that dad will be fine
I'm trusting you okay all right okay
there we go I really honestly don't feel
clean I really don't feel a thing fans
of cellulose insulation also say that it
provides a better air and sound barrier
than other materials Chris had a couple
of less inflammatory ways of showing me
those properties and we have here a
personal alarm and so we will set it off
and we'll put it in here and we'll see
that the fiberglass insulation muffles
it somewhat and we'll take the same
sound and put it into the fight out of
cellulose our cellulose insulation has
worked out pretty well for us though
experts suggest that we might have done
just as well with fiberglass or another
material if you're thinking of improving
the insulation in your home make sure
you've got enough and that it's properly
installed if you'd like to find out more
or compare different types of insulation
you can visit energy savers gov me I'm
sticking with cellulose after all I do
work for a newspaper
you
